resource.name: Collisions in Tacoma
resource.description:
All collisions within the City boundaries from 2010-Q42018. Data is from WSDOT.

Federal highway safety laws require the state to create this crash database for use in obtaining federal safety improvement funds. Under Section 409 of Title 23 of the United States Code, crash data is prohibited from use in any litigation against state, tribal or local government that involves the location(s) mentioned in the crash data.

resource.name: City of Tacoma Hate Bias (2013-2021)
resource.description: The data represents all National Incident Based Reporting System (NIBRS) Group A offenses and Harassment in the Group B category that indicated Hate Bias on the report. The data is not NIBRS compliant and cannot be compared to any reports using that standard. The data does not represent the number of incidents or individuals. A victim might be listed multiple times depending on the number of offenses with Hate Biased indicated on a single report and there could also be multiple victims per incident.  The data is based on the best available information and is subject to change and/or revision.
columns_name: Tacoma Neighborhood Council District Shape Map
columns_description: The day of week the incident was reported to have occurred on (1=Monday, 2=Tuesday etc.)
The police reporting block the offense occurred in
The year of the date the incident was reported to have occurred during

Name of business, organization etc., if listed as the victim
Resident Status of victim (i.e., did the victim reside in Tacoma)
Gender of victim
The police sector the offense occurred in
Type of Location incident (e.g., Restaurant, Parking Lot)
Indicates if the offense was completed or attempted
Resolution if any of the incident
Ethnicity of victim

100 Block of Incident Location

resource.description: Public charging stations make all-electric vehicles (EV) and plug-in hybrid electric vehicles (PHEV) more convenient. resource.name: Tacoma Overall Pavement Condition
resource.description: Data shows the average pavement condition index (PCI) score for all City streets. The higher the number the better. Another survey to gather pavement data is expected to occur in 2019/2020.
